page.title: 19"BOW YOUTH CLUB HELPS"
page.content: This account of village enterprise & generosity was taken from The Crediton Courier May 1985. "SERVED LUNCH FOR OTHERS" Members of Bow Youth Club gave up Saturday morning to serve lunches for Christian Aid.They were efficient and cheerful waiters and waitresses for the people who kept the Church Room at Bow full for most of the lunch time. They offered,for Â£1,four sorts of soup ,sandwiches,salad,coffee or squash. There was much friendly barracking of the waiting staff,but they took it in good heart.Each table was prettily decorated with a small vase of flowers which has been given, as was most of the food served that morning.Mr.S.Saunders,club leader,said the idea grew from a comment made at a church meeting."
